topic.title: About Liquid Content™ Content Type Fields for POST and PUT APIs

titlealts.navtitle: Content Type Fields for POST and PUT

section.p: The JSON structure in the body of the POST request requires a fields array, and each field in the content type is defined as a node in the fields array.

Example of a JSON node in the fields array:
"fields": [ ... { "type": "singleLineText", "defaultValue": null, "setDefaultValueAsHidden": false, "settings": { "subType": "singleLine", "phoneNumberFormat": null }, "validation": { "requireField": { "active": true, "errorMessage": "This is a required field" }, "numberOfCharacters": { "active": false, "rangeDefinition": "between", "minimum": null, "minimumUnit": null, "maximum": null, "maximumUnit": null, "errorMessage": "This field does not meet the required number of characters" }, "standardErrorMessage": null }, "id": "aa50984e-b459-4caa-94b9-5fa3a95ff082", "name": "lastName", "label": "Last Name", "descriptionActive": false, "description": "", "tooltipActive": false, "tooltip": "", "row": 0, "width": "half", "position": "half" }, ... ]
section.note: Evoq UI is the easiest way to create content types in most cases. To copy content types to multiple sites/servers, you can use the Export/Import feature.
section.p:
If you want to create multiple similar content types or if you want to recreate the same content types for testing,
create one of the content types in the UI,
request (GET) that content type from your app,
clean up the resulting JSON to remove the specific values, such as the id of the content type and of reference fields, and
replace the old values with values for the new type.

stentry.p: If the number of characters must be restricted, you can specify a range, only the minimum, or only the maximum.
Range restriction: If the text must have 5 to 140 characters,
stentry.codeblock: "numberOfCharacters": { "active": true, "rangeDefinition": "between", "minimum": 5, "minimumUnit": null, "maximum": 140, "maximumUnit": null, "errorMessage": "This field does not meet the required number of characters" },

stentry.codeblock: "numberOfCharacters": { "active": true, "rangeDefinition": "minimum", "minimum": 20, "minimumUnit": null, "maximum": null, "maximumUnit": null, "errorMessage": "This field does not meet the required number of characters" },

stentry.codeblock: "numberOfCharacters": { "active": true, "rangeDefinition": "maximum", "minimum": null, "minimumUnit": null, "maximum": 500, "maximumUnit": null, "errorMessage": "This field does not meet the required number of characters" },

stentry.p: If the field can contain any number of references,
stentry.codeblock: "numberOfReferences": { "active": false, "rangeDefinition": null, "minimum": null, "minimumUnit": null, "maximum": null, "maximumUnit": null, "errorMessage": null },
stentry.p: If the number of references must be restricted, you can specify a range, only the minimum, or only the maximum.
Range restriction: If the field must refer to 2 to 5 content items,
stentry.codeblock: "numberOfReferences": { "active": true, "rangeDefinition": "between", "minimum": 2, "minimumUnit": null, "maximum": 5, "maximumUnit": null, "errorMessage": "This field does not meet the required number of references" },
stentry.p: Minimum restriction: If the field must refer to at least 2 content items,
stentry.codeblock: "numberOfReferences": { "active": true, "rangeDefinition": "minimum", "minimum": 2, "minimumUnit": null, "maximum": null, "maximumUnit": null, "errorMessage": "This field does not meet the required number of references" },
stentry.p: Maximum restriction: If the field must refer to no more than 5 content items,
stentry.codeblock: "numberOfReferences": { "active": true, "rangeDefinition": "maximum", "minimum": null, "minimumUnit": null, "maximum": 5, "maximumUnit": null, "errorMessage": "This field does not meet the required number of references" },

stentry.p: If the date is not restricted,
If the date must be restricted, you can specify a date range (between), only the start date (after), or only the end date (before).
Range restriction: If the date must fall between 2017-07-10 and 2017-07-14,
stentry.codeph: "dateRange": { "active": true, "rangeDefinition": "between", "startDateTime": "2017-07-10T19:00:00Z", "endDateTime": "2017-07-14T19:00:00Z", "errorMessage": "Your date is not within the accepted date range." }
stentry.p: Start date restriction: If the date must be after 2017-07-31,
stentry.codeph: "dateRange": { "active": true, "rangeDefinition": "after", "startDateTime": "2017-07-31T19:00:00Z", "endDateTime": null, "errorMessage": "Your date is not within the accepted date range." }
stentry.p: End date restriction: If the date must be before 2017-07-01,
stentry.codeph: "dateRange": { "active": true, "rangeDefinition": "before", "startDateTime": null, "endDateTime": "2017-07-01T19:00:00Z", "errorMessage": "Your date is not within the accepted date range." }

stentry.p: If the time is not restricted,
If the time must be restricted, you can specify a time span (between), only the start time (after), or only the end time (before).
Span restriction: If the time must fall within a time span,
stentry.codeph: "timeRange": { "active": true, "rangeDefinition": "between", "startDateTime": "09:00:00", "endDateTime": "19:59:00", "errorMessage": "Your time is not within the accepted time range." }
stentry.p: Start time restriction: If the time must be after 21:00,
stentry.codeph: "timeRange": { "active": true, "rangeDefinition": "after", "startDateTime": "21:00:00", "endDateTime": "23:59:00", "errorMessage": "Your time is not within the accepted time range." }
stentry.p: End time restriction: If the time must be before 05:00,
stentry.codeph: "timeRange": { "active": true, "rangeDefinition": "before", "startDateTime": "00:00:00", "endDateTime": "05:00:00", "errorMessage": "Your time is not within the accepted time range." },

section.title: User Hints
section.p: To provide hints that describe the purpose of the field, you can add a field description or a tooltip.

strow.stentry:
Set descriptionActive to true to display the value of description below the field in the Evoq UI.
No description:
"descriptionActive": false, "description": ""
With description:
"descriptionActive": true, "description": "This is the field description."

Set tooltipActive to true to include the information icon, which displays the value of tooltip when clicked/tapped in the Evoq UI.
No tooltip:
"tooltipActive": false, "tooltip": ""
With tooltip:
"tooltipActive": true, "tooltip": "This is the field's tooltip."

section.title: UI Positioning
section.p: Some settings are required to display the content type correctly in the UI. The canvas that displays the fields are comprised of rows. Each row can be divided into three or four equal parts, and each part contains one field.

strow.stentry:
The numbering of rows are zero-based; therefore, the first row is Row 0.
Example: "row" : 2

The width of the field, relative to the width of the canvas. Possible values are:
full
threeQuarters
twoThirds
half
third
quarter
The division of the row must be consistent between width and position.
Examples:
"width" : "full"
"width" : "twoThirds"
"width" : "quarter"

The position of the field in the row.
If the row is divided into four sections, possible values are:
start
quarter
half
threeQuarters
If the row is divided into three sections, possible values are:
start
third
twoThirds
The division of the row must be consistent between width and position.
Examples:
"position" : "start"
"position" : "half"
"position" : "third"

section.note: If a row overflows (i.e., too many fields), if fields overlap in a row, or if the fields assume a different type of row division (i.e., one field uses quarters and another uses thirds), your POST request might be rejected.
section.p: If width is full, the position must be start, and no other fields are allowed in the same row.
